required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability and Validity of the ISNCSCI in Patients With Non-traumatic Spinal Cord Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability and Validity of the International Standards for Neurological Classification of Spinal Cord Injury in Patients With Non-traumatic Spinal Cord Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the study is to assess the psychometric properties of the International Standards for Neurological Classification of Spinal Cord Injury in subjects with non traumatic lesions.

detailed_description.textblock: All patients with non-traumatic SCI consecutively admitted to three Italian SCI centers (IRCCS Fondazione Santa Lucia, Montecatone Rehabilitation Hospital and Istituti Clinici Scientifici Maugeri IRCCS of Pavia) between January 1st 2017 and June 30th 2020 have been prospectively enrolled in the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Interanational Standards for Neurological Classification of Spinal Cord Injury
primary_outcome.description: standards to evaluate neurological status of subject with spinal cord injury

secondary_outcome.description: Outcome measure to evaluate the independence in daily life activities for subjects with spinal cord injury

study_pop.textblock: All patients with non traumatic spinal cord lesions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- having a non-traumatic SCI
- acute / subacute phase
- any level and severity (ASIA Impairment Scale) of injury
- having a cognitive status that allows collaboration in the exam.
Exclusion Criteria:
- presence of dementia or cognitive decline;
- having a pathology of the peripheral nervous system that may affect the evaluation of ISNCSCI;
- having a multiple sclerosis

International Standards for Neurological Classification of Spinal Cord Injury: Revised 2019. Top Spinal Cord Inj Rehabil. 2021 Spring;27(2):1-22. doi: 10.46292/sci2702-1.

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized data will be available upon reasonable request

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
